 16  """This module contains support for generating bindings from an XML stream 
 17  using a SAX parser."""

 30 -class _SAXElementState (pyxb.utils.saxutils.SAXElementState): 

 31      """State required to generate bindings for a specific element. 
 32   
 33      If the document being parsed includes references to unrecognized elements, 
 34      a DOM instance of the element and its content is created and treated as a 
 35      wildcard element. 
 36      """ 
 37   
 38      # An expanded name corresponding to xsi:nil 
 39      __XSINilTuple = XSI.nil.uriTuple() 
 40   
 41      # The binding instance being created for this element.  When the 
 42      # element type has simple content, the binding instance cannot be 
 43      # created until the end of the element has been reached and the 
 44      # content of the element has been processed accumulated for use in 
 45      # the instance constructor.  When the element type has complex 
 46      # content, the binding instance must be created at the start of 
 47      # the element, so contained elements can be properly stored. 
 48      __bindingInstance = None 
 49   
 50      # The schema binding for the element being constructed. 
 51      __elementBinding = None 
 52

 55   
 56          Generally ignored, except at the top level this is the only way to 
 57          associate a binding instance created from an xsi:type description with 
 58          a specific element.""" 
 59          self.__elementBinding = element_binding

 68          """ 
 69          return self.__enclosingCTD 

 70      __enclosingCTD = None

105      # Create the binding instance for this element. 

106 -    def __constructElement (self, new_object_factory, attrs, content=None): 

107          kw = { '_from_xml' : True, 
108                 '_location' : self.location() } 
109   
110          # Note whether the node is marked nil 
111          if attrs.has_key(self.__XSINilTuple): 
112              kw['_nil'] = pyxb.binding.datatypes.boolean(attrs.getValue(self.__XSINilTuple)) 
113   
114          if content is None: 
115              content = [] 
116          self.__bindingInstance = new_object_factory(*content, **kw) 
117          if isinstance(self.__bindingInstance, pyxb.utils.utility.Locatable_mixin): 
118              self.__bindingInstance._setLocation(self.location()) 
119   
120          # Record the namespace context so users of the binding can 
121          # interpret QNames within the attributes and content. 
122          self.__bindingInstance._setNamespaceContext(self.__namespaceContext) 
123   
124          # Set instance attributes 
125          # NB: attrs implements the SAX AttributesNS interface, meaning 
126          # that names are pairs of (namespaceURI, localName), just like we 
127          # want them to be. 
128          for attr_name in self.__attributes.getNames(): 
129              attr_en = pyxb.namespace.ExpandedName(attr_name) 
130              # Ignore xmlns and xsi attributes; we've already handled those 
131              if attr_en.namespace() in ( pyxb.namespace.XMLNamespaces, XSI ): 
132                  continue 
133              # The binding instance may be a simple type that does not support 
134              # attributes; the following raises an exception in that case. 
135              self.__bindingInstance._setAttribute(attr_en, attrs.getValue(attr_name)) 
136   
137          return self.__bindingInstance

142 -    def enterDOMMode (self, attrs): 

143          """Actions upon first encountering an element for which we cannot create a binding. 
144   
145          Invoking this transitions the parser into DOM mode, creating a new DOM 
146          document that will represent this element including its content.""" 
147          assert not self.__domDocument 
148          self.__domDocument = pyxb.utils.saxdom.Document(namespace_context=self.namespaceContext()) 
149          self.__domDepth = 0 
150          return self.startDOMElement(attrs) 

151   

152 -    def startDOMElement (self, attrs): 

153          """Actions upon entering an element that is part of a DOM subtree.""" 
154          self.__domDepth += 1 
155          self.__attributes = pyxb.utils.saxdom.NamedNodeMap() 
156          ns_ctx = self.namespaceContext() 
157          for name in attrs.getNames(): 
158              attr_en = pyxb.namespace.ExpandedName(name) 
159              self.__attributes._addItem(pyxb.utils.saxdom.Attr(expanded_name=attr_en, namespace_context=ns_ctx, value=attrs.getValue(name), location=self.location())) 

160   

161 -    def endDOMElement (self): 

162          """Actions upon leaving an element that is part of a DOM subtree.""" 
163          ns_ctx = self.namespaceContext() 
164          element = pyxb.utils.saxdom.Element(namespace_context=ns_ctx, expanded_name=self.expandedName(), attributes=self.__attributes, location=self.location()) 
165          for info in self.content(): 
166              if isinstance(info.item, xml.dom.Node): 
167                  element.appendChild(info.item) 
168              else: 
169                  element.appendChild(pyxb.utils.saxdom.Text(info.item, namespace_context=ns_ctx)) 
170          self.__domDepth -= 1 
171          if 0 == self.__domDepth: 
172              self.__domDocument.appendChild(element) 
173              #pyxb.utils.saxdom._DumpDOM(self.__domDocument) 
174              self.__domDepth = None 
175              self.__domDocument = None 
176          parent_state = self.parentState() 
177          parent_state.addElementContent(self.location(), element, None) 
178          return element

180 -    def startBindingElement (self, type_class, new_object_factory, element_decl, attrs): 

181          """Actions upon entering an element that will produce a binding instance. 
182   
183          The element use is recorded.  If the type is a subclass of 
184          L{basis.simpleTypeDefinition}, a delayed constructor is recorded so 
185          the binding instance can be created upon completion of the element; 
186          otherwise, a binding instance is created and stored.  The attributes 
187          are used to initialize the binding instance (now, or upon element 
188          end). 
189   
190          @param type_class: The Python type of the binding instance 
191          @type type_class: subclass of L{basis._TypeBinding_mixin} 
192          @param new_object_factory: A callable object that creates an instance of the C{type_class} 
193          @param element_decl: The element use with which the binding instance is associated.  Will be C{None} for top-level elements 
194          @type element_decl: L{basis.element} 
195          @param attrs: The XML attributes associated with the element 
196          @type attrs: C{xml.sax.xmlreader.Attributes} 
197          @return: The generated binding instance, or C{None} if creation is delayed 
198          """ 
199          self.__delayedConstructor = None 
200          self.__elementDecl = element_decl 
201          self.__attributes = attrs 
202          if type_class._IsSimpleTypeContent(): 
203              self.__delayedConstructor = new_object_factory 
204          else: 
205              self.__constructElement(new_object_factory, attrs) 
206          return self.__bindingInstance 

207   

208 -    def endBindingElement (self): 

209          """Perform any end-of-element processing. 
210   
211          For simple type instances, this creates the binding instance. 
212          @return: The generated binding instance 
213          """ 
214          if self.__delayedConstructor is not None: 
215              args = [] 
216              for info in self.content(): 
217                  assert not info.maybe_element 
218                  assert info.element_decl is None 
219                  assert isinstance(info.item, basestring) 
220                  args.append(info.item) 
221              assert 1 >= len(args), 'Unexpected STD content %s' % (args,) 
222              self.__constructElement(self.__delayedConstructor, self.__attributes, args) 
223          else: 
224              for info in self.content(): 
225                  self.__bindingInstance.append(info.item, 
226                                                _element_decl=info.element_decl, 
227                                                _maybe_element=info.maybe_element, 
228                                                _location=info.location) 
229          parent_state = self.parentState() 
230          if parent_state is not None: 
231              parent_state.addElementContent(self.location(), self.__bindingInstance, self.__elementDecl) 
232          # As CreateFromDOM does, validate the resulting element 
233          if self.__bindingInstance._element() is None: 
234              self.__bindingInstance._setElement(self.__elementBinding) 
235          return self.__bindingInstance._postDOMValidate()

237 -class PyXBSAXHandler (pyxb.utils.saxutils.BaseSAXHandler): 

238      """A SAX handler class which generates a binding instance for a document 
239      through a streaming parser. 
240   
241      An example of using this to parse the document held in the string C{xmls} is:: 
242   
243        import pyxb.binding.saxer 
244        import StringIO 
245   
246        saxer = pyxb.binding.saxer.make_parser() 
247        handler = saxer.getContentHandler() 
248        saxer.parse(StringIO.StringIO(xml)) 
249        instance = handler.rootObject() 
250   
251      """ 
252   
253      # Whether invocation of handler methods should be traced 
254      __trace = False 
255   
256      # An expanded name corresponding to xsi:type 
257      __XSITypeTuple = XSI.type.uriTuple() 
258   
259      __domHandler = None 
260      __domDepth = None 
261   

262 -    def rootObject (self): 

263          """Return the binding object corresponding to the top-most 
264          element in the document 
265   
266          @return: An instance of L{basis._TypeBinding_mixin} (most usually a 
267          L{basis.complexTypeDefinition}. 
268   
269          @raise pyxb.[UnrecognizedDOMRootNodeError: No binding could be found to 
270          match the top-level element in the document.""" 
271          if not isinstance(self.__rootObject, basis._TypeBinding_mixin): 
272              # Happens if the top-level element got processed as a DOM instance. 
273              assert isinstance(self.__rootObject, xml.dom.Node) 
274              raise pyxb.UnrecognizedDOMRootNodeError(self.__rootObject) 
275          return self.__rootObject._postDOMValidate() 

276      __rootObject = None 
277   

278 -    def reset (self): 

279          """Reset the state of the handler in preparation for processing a new 
280          document. 
281   
282          @return: C{self} 
283          """ 
284          super(PyXBSAXHandler, self).reset() 
285          self.__rootObject = None 
286          return self 

287

293          constructor<pyxb.utils.saxutils.BaseSAXHandler.__init__>}. 
294          """ 
295   
296          kw.setdefault('element_state_constructor', _SAXElementState) 
297          super(PyXBSAXHandler, self).__init__(**kw) 
298          self.reset()

300 -    def startElementNS (self, name, qname, attrs): 

301          (this_state, parent_state, ns_ctx, name_en) = super(PyXBSAXHandler, self).startElementNS(name, qname, attrs) 
302   
303          # Delegate processing if in DOM mode 
304          if this_state.inDOMMode(): 
305              return this_state.startDOMElement(attrs) 
306   
307          # Resolve the element within the appropriate context.  Note 
308          # that global elements have no use, only the binding. 
309          if parent_state.enclosingCTD() is not None: 
310              (element_binding, element_decl) = parent_state.enclosingCTD()._ElementBindingDeclForName(name_en) 
311          else: 
312              element_decl = None 
313              element_binding = name_en.elementBinding() 
314          this_state.setElementBinding(element_binding) 
315   
316          # Non-root elements should have an element use, from which we can 
317          # extract the binding if we couldn't find one elsewhere.  (Keep any 
318          # current binding, since it may be a member of a substitution group.) 
319          if (element_decl is not None) and (element_binding is None): 
320              assert self.__rootObject is not None 
321              element_binding = element_decl.elementBinding() 
322              assert element_binding is not None 
323   
324          # Start knowing nothing 
325          type_class = None 
326          if element_binding is not None: 
327              element_binding = element_binding.elementForName(name) 
328              type_class = element_binding.typeDefinition() 
329   
330          # Process an xsi:type attribute, if present 
331          if attrs.has_key(self.__XSITypeTuple): 
332              (did_replace, type_class) = XSI._InterpretTypeAttribute(attrs.getValue(self.__XSITypeTuple), ns_ctx, self.fallbackNamespace(), type_class) 
333              if did_replace: 
334                  element_binding = None 
335   
336          if type_class is None: 
337              # Bother.  We don't know what this thing is.  But that's not an 
338              # error, if the schema accepts wildcards.  For consistency with 
339              # the DOM-based interface, we need to build a DOM node. 
340              return this_state.enterDOMMode(attrs) 
341   
342          if element_binding is not None: 
343              # Invoke binding __call__ method not Factory, so can check for 
344              # abstract elements. 
345              new_object_factory = element_binding 
346          else: 
347              new_object_factory = type_class.Factory 
348   
349          # Update the enclosing complex type definition for this 
350          # element state. 
351          assert type_class is not None 
352          if issubclass(type_class, pyxb.binding.basis.complexTypeDefinition): 
353              this_state.setEnclosingCTD(type_class) 
354          else: 
355              this_state.setEnclosingCTD(parent_state.enclosingCTD()) 
356   
357          # Process the element start.  This may or may not return a 
358          # binding object. 
359          binding_object = this_state.startBindingElement(type_class, new_object_factory, element_decl, attrs) 
360   
361          # If the top-level element has complex content, this sets the 
362          # root object.  If it has simple content, see endElementNS. 
363          if self.__rootObject is None: 
364              self.__rootObject = binding_object 

365   

366 -    def endElementNS (self, name, qname): 

367          this_state = super(PyXBSAXHandler, self).endElementNS(name, qname) 
368          if this_state.inDOMMode(): 
369              # Delegate processing if in DOM mode.  Note that completing this 
370              # element may take us out of DOM mode.  In any case, the returned 
371              # binding object is a DOM element instance. 
372              binding_object = this_state.endDOMElement() 
373          else: 
374              # Process the element end.  This will return a binding object, 
375              # either the one created at the start or the one created at 
376              # the end. 
377              binding_object = this_state.endBindingElement() 
378          assert binding_object is not None 
379   
380          # If we don't have a root object, save it.  No, there is not a 
381          # problem doing this on the close of the element.  If the 
382          # top-level element has complex content, the object was 
383          # created on start, and the root object has been assigned.  If 
384          # it has simple content, then there are no internal elements 
385          # that could slip in and set this before we get to it here. 
386          # 
387          # Unless we're still in DOM mode, in which case this isn't really the 
388          # root object.  Then the real root object will be the one that caused 
389          # us to enter DOM mode. 
390          if (self.__rootObject is None) and not this_state.inDOMMode(): 
391              self.__rootObject = binding_object

393 -def make_parser (*args, **kw): 

394      """Extend L{pyxb.utils.saxutils.make_parser} to change the default 
395      C{content_handler_constructor} to be L{PyXBSAXHandler}. 
396      """ 
397      kw.setdefault('content_handler_constructor', PyXBSAXHandler)
